section.title: Photos
section.para:
The Photos Tab displays thumbnail images of all the photos in your show. You can add and remove photos from your show, and change the order in which your photos are displayed during your show.
When you are in Expert Mode, the Expert Panel is also displayed in the Photos Tab. This panel provides additional settings you can apply to selected photos. See for more information.

section.title: Adding Photos
section.para: The Photos... button and the Photos... menu item in the File menu both display the Photo file chooser, allowing you to select photos to include in your show. Each time you use the Photo file chooser, the photos you choose are added to the your show along with any existing photos. So you can choose photos from one folder and add them to the show, then use the Photo file chooser again to select additional photos from a different folder.

Thumbnails of the photos you open are displayed in the Photos Tab. The order in which the thumbnails are displayed is the order in which the photos will play back during the show. You can delete photos from your show and change their order using the Photos Tab.

listitem.para: Displays the photo image files and folders in the current folder. Click on a filename to select it, Ctrl-Click and Shift-Click to select multiple files at one time. Click Open when you have selected the photos you want.
Opens all photo files in the current directory. This is a shortcut to avoid selecting each file individually.
When this checkbox is checked, a thumbnail of the currently selected photo file will be displayed.

Select Image to display image files. Select Flash file to display Macromedia Flash files. Flash animations can be loaded into a show and treated like a photo. The Preview thumbnail is disabled for Flash files.

section.title: Selecting Photos
section.para: You can select a single photo by clicking on it. Hold the Ctrl key while clicking additional photo thumbnails to select multiple photos. You can select a range of photos. Click to select the first photo in the range, then hold the Shift key and click the last photo in the range. All photos in between the first and last photo will be selected. In the Edit menu, use Select All to select all photos, and Deselect All to deselect all photos.

section.title: Manipulating Photos
section.para: You can change the ordering of photos by dragging them. Select the photos you want to move, then drag them to their new position and release the mouse button to move them there. As you drag the selected photos, a black insertion cursor will be drawn between photos to show you where the photos will be inserted when you drop them.

You can duplicate photos by copying and pasting. Select the photos you want to copy and choose Copy from the Edit menu. Then select the photo after which you want to place the duplicated photos and choose Paste. Copies of the selected photos will be inserted.
You can remove photos from your show by selecting them and choosing Delete from the Edit menu. You can also use Cut to remove photos, cut photos can then be pasted back into the show using Paste.
Add new photos to your show using the Photos... button. See for more information.

section.title: Viewing Photos
section.para:
Double clicking on a thumbnail will display that photo in the Photo Viewer. This presents the photo in a larger size, allowing you to see more detail. While in the viewer you can step through the photos in your show using the viewer buttons. You can also delete the currently viewed photo from within the viewer.
When in Expert Mode, you can also display the viewer using the View photo button in the Expert Panel. See for more information.

section.title: Photo Tooltips
section.para:
Pausing your mouse over a photo thumbnail (without clicking) will cause a tooltip to be displayed near the upper right corner of the window.
Photo Tooltip
The tooltip contains the photo filename followed by the time at which the photo will be displayed in your show in parenthesis (minutes:seconds.hundredths). Below that, the beginning transition, effect and ending transition names are displayed. The ending transition is followed by the ending transition layer in parenthesis.
